channel.title: Can Vista make a comeback?
channel.description:
Recently Vista's Service Pack 1 was released, and I have noticed a big difference in the speed. Also my explorer windows load faster. So do you think Microsoft may actually do something right?
Discuss.

item.title: Can Vista make a comeback?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“IP-Drowner, post:16, topic:191123”]To me, at the moment, Vista is better than XP. It is more reliable, easy-to-understand interface and has a nice looking interface. But Linux is the system i hate because it is slower, and why is it for free when they could easily make money off it? Because the owners of Linux know that it is not a better system than Windows.[/quote]Linux… slow? I assure you, Arch (I won’t comment on lesser distros) is a hell of a lot faster than Vista, even if you load it up with GNOME and run it on a VM.

item.title: Can Vista make a comeback?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

IP-Drowner:

To me, at the moment, Vista is better than XP. It is more reliable, easy-to-understand interface and has a nice looking interface. But Linux is the system i hate because it is slower, and why is it for free when they could easily make money off it? Because the owners of Linux know that it is not a better system than Windows.

The interface is easier in XP than Vista.

The is some Linux versions that cost money.
And because Linux is Open-Source (Don’t remember what the lisens was called) you can get it free and legit.
So no need to pay for them.

And remember one thing to, there is lots of Linux, not only that one crappy you have tryed.

item.title: Can Vista make a comeback?
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

IP-Drowner:

To me, at the moment, Vista is better than XP. It is more reliable, easy-to-understand interface and has a nice looking interface. But Linux is the system i hate because it is slower, and why is it for free when they could easily make money off it? Because the owners of Linux know that it is not a better system than Windows.

No, because they aren’t money hungry mongrels, unlike most people in the world today.
Also, what’s this about an “easy-to-understand interface”? Wasn’t XP simple and easy to understand too?

-Holic

Read full topic

item.title: Can Vista make a comeback?
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“nator123123, post:15, topic:191123”]LONG way to go…

Linux != BSOD && Windows == BSOD
blah . . .[/quote]

That’s obviously a ‘tad’ biased (and wth @ the operators?)… For a while I really hated Vista, explorer.exe would crash at random times and the data transfer was really slow (from my computer->usb drive), but I started updating to builds of SP1 and it got faster, and smoother. My computers a year old AMD 2GHz Dual-Core (3800+?) with 1.5GB ram, and a shitty onboard graphics card… And it actually runs really smooth. I can even play games like Call Of Duty 4 on it with only a bit of lag on graphic intense combat scenes (many explosions, etc…)

All in all, Vista’s performance still needs to be updated a bit, and UAC is a bitch sometimes (you can disable it…).

[size=8pt]edit: this isn’t a topic about comparing vista to linux btw…[/size]

Read full topic

Linux can’t run EXE files. Only some under WINE, which is REALLY buggy.
